{% trans "The Standard Sample Types page allows existing sample types to be modified. A Sample type is DART's way of connecting fimular users names like 'salts' and 'oxy' and how those variables are read from files to Biochem datatypes."%}

{% trans "Sample Types come in three main levels." %}

  • {% trans "The 'Standard' sample type is the default way the biochem datatype portion of a sample type should be applied in most cases when uploading data to biochem." %}
  • {% trans "A 'Mission' sample type allows the biochem datatype portion of a sample type to be applied differently for a specific mission." %}
  • {% trans "'Row level' sample types allow the biochem datatype to be applied differently for specific samples within a mission" %}

{% trans "Note that modifying a 'Standard' level sample type will affect all missions where the standard level sample type has been used, good practice would be to apply the standard sample type at a mission level if there's ever a chance the sample type would could be different between missions." %}

{% trans "The above image shows a 'Standard' sample type layout. Typeically sample types are created at the time they are requires on the mission samples page, but the can be created and modifeid on the Standard Sample Types Page." %}
